intro: Tetrastylidium grandifolium, commonly known as the large-leaf tetrastylidium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
